As we get ready to honor the OGHS Class of 2020, we are often asked about certain graduation traditons. One of those is the moving of the graduates tassel. Here are a few reasons for this tradition.

Why do graduates move the tassel?
The gesture of moving the tassel from one side of the cap to the other symbolizes the individual's movement from candidate to graduate. Prior to the ceremony the tassel is expected to be worn on the right. During the ceremony it should be moved to the left side after students receive their diploma.
Some believe the reason why you place the tassel on the right is because you have earned the right to graduate. Moving the tassel to the left after graduating is symbolic of crossing over from high school to another stage in your life.
Good luck to the Class of 2020 as they prepare to take their place in the world outside of the halls of OGHS.

Here is an example of an online lesson Mrs. Vicki Otto is working on with her students. I will share her lesson in a couple of different posts/replys.

Hello Everyone!! I miss you guys already! I put the eggs in the incubator last night and wanted to share with you what’s happening! I took pictures of them in the incubator. The incubator is the styrofoam container that keeps them very warm so they can develop into chicks! You will see the temperature is almost 100 degrees inside. I put 14 eggs in the incubator, we will see how many will hatch! I also have to put water in the bottom of it to keep the humidity up so they can grow inside the eggs! The last picture is of a plastic egg that I have that I will show you every day what is happening inside the egg! Let me know if you have any questions as we go! Feel free to make comments right on the page here that everyone can see! :)

How many eggs do you think will hatch? Put your name and your prediction down!

As a result of the mandate from Governor DeWine, the Ottawa-Glandorf Local School District will take the following compliance steps:
• School will be closed for students beginning at 8am Monday, March 16th through Friday, April 3rd at 3pm

• All school facility use by students and the public will be prohibited from March 14 through April 5, 2020. This includes gymnasiums, weight rooms, indoor batting cages, track facilities, baseball and softball diamonds, etc.

Thank you to the OG staff and students who were able to help the residents and staff members of Autumn Court today. I appreciate everyone who was able to set up cots, help in the cafeteria, and bring the residents needed items.

Autumn Court had a small fire, and needed a temporary place for their residents to go until they can get back into their building, and our staff was glad to help. A big shout out to the local fire departments, the Ottawa Police Department, the Red Cross, and the Putnam County EMA staff members. Our local safety service organizations are amazing.

One more example of what a great community we live in. A place where everyone is willing to help out a neighbor in need.

Titan Pride!!!!
